title: Where is the counterplay for Rengar?
body: Seriously, this is a legitimate question.

replies.body:
Positioning. 

Rengar is like the monster in a monster movie.

Don't leave the group and shield your squishies from his view.

You know he has ulted the second that he does now and he can only target 1 person, the closest from him.

He doesn't become problematic until after he has gotten a few Bonetooth stacks.
And then when he does get out of hand, he doesn't seem to care that you've grouped up. Hell, if you're too tight, he'll kill **two** people in the time it takes for Kat's E to cast.

CC, moustly. Garen, Syndra, Anivia, Veigar, ... The objetive is not letting him get close and personal with you. And if he does, make him regret it. It is the normal proces with this things. Get used to him.
He has Olafs ultimate as a normal ability. He laughs at your CC.

> [{quoted}](name=Neko Caitlyn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OKm4mGUE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-11-16T08:28:49.824+0000)
>
> He has Olafs ultimate as a normal ability. He laughs at your CC.

If he chooses to remove CC his damage is lacking. You also need to prepare. Usually you'd go R -> Jump E W Q Q and that's it. It's hard for him to keep his Ferocity up without committing to a fight completely and then using Empowered W is still not something he wants.

His damage is a bit on the higher side, that empowered Q could lose like 40 base damage and would still be good.  But other than that he still has the same problems: Useless if you anticipate him. He gets blown up and now he doesn't even have stealth from which he can kill you. You will know that he is coming and you will be able to see him.

> Group up and kill him when he tries to make a play. Rengar can't jump into 5 people (unless he is stupidly fed, and even then, hard CC wrecks him). He will obliterate your whole team if he gets the chance to do it, so don't give it to him. 
> TL;DR - "Group up and hit it till it dies!"

This is the problem. If the counter to Rengar is fighting him with 5 people at a time, and he can STILL kill your entire team solo, that is a clear problem

He can cleanse CC though, and as soon as he gets a couple of stacks on his bonetooth necklace it doesn't matter. I would also counter your point by saying that, in relation to all of the available champions in LoL, very few can 1v5

His main damage tool is now a 2 part skillshot. He is no longer completely invisible. The warning for ult has a longer distance and he can't hop on whoever he wants. His rework was an assassin done right.

The reality is there are a lot more options than there used to be. If he's broken it has to do more with his current numbers than him just having a busted kit. 

Counterplay has to do with the kit in general, which is healthier than before. If he has too much easy access to AD that it doesn't seem to matter, then he can be  adjusted.

{{champion:75}} with 5,000,000 stacks so you can one shot him before he melts you.

{{champion:45}} with 250 stacks so you can Q him plus R him if he hops on you (This is based on luck and reaction time, Rengar will kill you in 1-2 hits most the time anyways lol).
I could ask the same about {{champion:67}} .

There honestly isn't much once he is on you HOWEVER..... when he ults has far more counter-play than it ever did.  Before hand you as the tank just watched as your adc/mage got removed from the game if someone with exhaust didn't have god reactions and/or you didn't have a pink ward.  Now, tanks can actually position themselves between rengar and their squishies like some makeshift "get down mister president" body guard who either is the one targeted instead or he has to walk by you, giving you vision of himself (since his ult is just camouflage) and thus an opportunity to more directly stop him.  Also, while the god tier exhaust reaction speed still works, now you can theoretically flash his Q or otherwise dodge it or he could even just straight up miss it if he panics or something. 

Now I DO think he just overall has way too much dmg, however he has more counter-play than ever before.  Also not gonna lie playing as tanky vi against rengar really enforces the bodyguard feel and I actually find the whole little thing where I escorted my squishies around pretty cool since I knew I was the only thing standing between them and 1000AD or something.
Watching IWD insta-gib and have 500 AD before 30 minutes is becoming a bit too common, even if I like Rengar in general.
